channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16157] The incorrect block cache count and size are caused by removing duplicate block key in the LruBlockCache
item.description:
LruBlockCache.java

// Check return value from the Map#remove before updating the metrics

  protected long evictBlock(LruCachedBlock block, boolean evictedByEvictionProcess) {

    map.remove(block.getCacheKey());

    updateSizeMetrics(block, true);

...

}
item.summary: The incorrect block cache count and size are caused by removing duplicate block key in the LruBlockCache

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
514	    boolean find = map.remove(block.getCacheKey()) != null;

nit: name the variable found.
You can use the following annotation for the two helper methods:


import com.google.common.annotations.VisibleForTesting;

Failed tests don't seem to be related to the patch.

+1 on v2.
lgtm. Is the test stable enough? Looks like it might end up being a flaky test.

The TestLruBlockCache#testCurrentSize may fail because the evict thread is too fast to get the "in progress" state.

I'll update the patch asap.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-Trunk_matrix #1150 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1150/)
HBASE-16157 The incorrect block cache count and size are caused by (tedyu: rev 5a7c9939cbe115c0d12d9cfe8bf9f3b3d11ac69e)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/io/hfile/LruBlockCache.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/io/hfile/TestLruBlockCache.java

It seem to me the v4 patch is better. The reasons are shown below：
1) The v4 patch makes LruBlockCache#evictBlocksByHfileName return the correct number of evicted block.
2) The v4 patch use the threads to test the thread-safe of cache eviction.
